body.name: Natracare Non-Applicator 100% Organic Cotton Tampons, Regular, Totally Chlorine Free, Biodegradable and Compostable (1 Pack, 20 Tampons Total)…
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35

climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging. MADE SAFE certifies products made without known toxic chemicals, by prohibiting substances that harm human health or the environment.

features: PLASTIC FREE : Did you know that a pack of conventional period products contains up to five plastic bags worth of plastic? We’re here to change that, with period products that are plastic free
NATURAL MATERIAL : It’s time to go back to basics. Natracare products are made from just a few simple, natural materials. No perfume, rayon or dyes and Totally Chlorine Free
CERTIFIED ORGANIC : We only use organic cotton certified to the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS). This means the cotton we use is healthier for you, workers and the planet
ETHICAL : Our entire supply chain, from raw materials and processing, shares in our commitment to manage and monitor resources respectfully and ethically
VEGAN : A vegan lifestyle isn’t just about food. In fact, many big period product manufacturers have a history of animal testing and poor welfare standards. We don’t
body.description: Our regular organic tampons are made with a rolled wadding of long-fibre organic cotton – designed to gently absorb menstrual flow and expand widthways. We only make organic tampons because most are made from a mix of rayon and non-organic cotton, and are commonly chlorine-bleached. Tampons often have a plastic wrapper, contain perfumes and even dyes. Rayon is a highly absorbent fibre which rapidly absorbs menstrual blood but at the same time can also dry out the natural protective mucous lining of the vagina. No-one should be exposed to pesticide residues, phthalates, azo-dyes and dioxins, especially in such a sensitive and absorptive part of the body. Know exactly what you put in your body.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just like OB, but better!
reviews.reviewText: I used OB tampons for years in an attempt to reduce the amount of waste produced by my tampon habit. After you get used to the lack of an applicator, it's really no big deal. Then, after considering the health implications of putting synthetic materials and chemically treated cotton into my body, I made the switch to organic tampons about 10 years ago. Not only would I rather have organic cotton in by body than synthetics for obvious reasons of preferring natural materials, but I've also read that they pose less risk of Toxic Shock Syndrome. I've tried a number of brands, but have found NatraCare to be my favorite for their ease of use, price, and ready availability on Amazon.One of my favorite things about these is that they are constructed well. As they absorb fluid, they unfold in a flower sort of shape that catches everything very efficiently. I can count on them to work, no matter what I'm doing. The tiny little individually wrapped tampons are also super discreet, and can fit into any little pocket without causing a scene. I've been using these for nearly 3 years, and will continue to buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Favorite for years
reviews.reviewText: These have been my favorite tampons for years. They are compact, comfortable, absorb well, and easy to unwrap and carry. I buy three sizes to store in a container, that keeps me stocked up for a few months. I love that they don’t have applicators. I think applicators are the most useless and wasteful invention. I definitely recommend these!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works for me
reviews.reviewText: I use these with my reusable applicator and I'm happy to not have the extra plastic every month. They're comfortable and work just as well as any other brand I've used.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Take getting used to
reviews.reviewText: These take a little getting used to when you are used to using plastic applicators. It's just a concentrated cotton swab really. It takes getting used to putting in correctly. They are also quite small when compared to the "super" size or super + that the big brands have. They are literally half the size compared to the pearls. Nonetheless, they still work when properly inserted. Another caveat is they are individually wrapped in tight plastic which is difficult to get out at times and a nuisance to deal with the multiple pieces of plastic in your hands in the bathroom, while still needing to place the tampon in. I am happy that this is organic cotton so I will stick with this until something better comes along.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It does what it's supposed to do
reviews.reviewText: I am trying to be eco-conscious on the products I buy and use. So I wanted to find something natural for my monthly natural "occurrence" (lol). Pretty self explanatory on how to apply this. I am actually impress for how small the thing is that is absorbs good amount for medium bleeders. I don't think it would be good for heavy users if so, you'll definitely change it more often. As for no applicator, I don't see the big deal. Its really fine, nothing difficult to apply it. Overall, glad I am reducing my waste consumption.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best “natural” tampons I’ve found so far
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been trying out various natural tampons, and so far this is the one that works the best for me. Absorbency seems the same for all the tampons I’ve tried, regardless of brand (and I typically use regulars through super pluses depending on the flow), but something about other tampons, even the natural ones, causes irritation (I have very sensitive skin and a lot of allergies), but not these. I also prefer the ones without an applicator (because you can carry them around much more discreetly, not to mention reducing all that excess waste).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Prompt delivery. Great priduct

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Safe materials used for this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use these along with cloth pads
reviews.reviewText: My real wish was to use the reusable silicone cup but since I was not able to these are the next best thing. You just can't go wrong with pure organic cotton for your sacred lady parts. During my moon phase, I use these during the day, and overnight I use cloth pads. These tampons work really well and application is easy even with long nails (just requires practice). I feel guilt-free with these because it's good for my body and also good for the environment due to minimal packaging. They are good quality.
lo uso per il kit di sovravivenza

Ne supportant plus du tout les serviettes et tampons de grande surface et n'étant pas très à l'aise avec la cup, j'ai tenté ceux-là. Merci de me permettre de nouveau de porter des tampons. Plus aucune réaction comme avec tous les autres tampons. Bonne absorption, confort.
